Allow to change current screen on NC to different screens by specified the panel group name and screen name.
This example shows how to call the ChangeScreen mothod.
Dim objCmdView As New Okuma.CMCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CViews Dim enPanelGroup As PanelGroupEnum = PanelGroupEnum.OperationMode Dim strScreenName As String = "" objview = New Okuma.CMCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CViews objview.ChangeScreen(enPanelGroup, strScreenName)
Panel group name where the screen resides. Screen name to be displayed as active screen on NC Thrown when function failes to perform the operation at current NC condition. Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system
If no screen name is specified, then the previous active screen or default screen name of the specified panel group name will be displayed.
[Lhuynh] 11/10/2006 Created

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Create a MOP Tool Data number with the specified tool number and its associated class number if it does not exist in the MOP Data table.
This example shows how to call the Edit mothod.
Dim objCmdMopTool As CMOPTool Dim intToolNo As Integer = 1 Dim intClassNo As Integer = 1 objCmdMopTool = New CMOPTool objCmdMopTool.Edit(intToolNo, intClassNo)
Tool number. Valid tool number is ranging from 1 - 999. Classification number for this tool number. Valid class numbers is from 0 to 9. Thrown when function failes to perform the operation at current NC condition. Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system
NC will assigned a MOP Tool data number for each tool number and its classification number automatically based on the current MOP Tool Data list such that the order of tool numbers and its classification numbers are displayed in ascending order. Therefore, a MOP Tool Data number assigned for a pair of tool number and its classification number could be changed if there is a deletion or addition to the MOP Tool Data table. For example, if tool number 45-0 is removed from the MOP Tool Data list, then tool 50-0 will has a MOP Tool Data number 4.
MOP TOOL - TOOL DATA SETING - ENTRY TOOL LIST - list of all MOP Tool Data and its associated tool number with classification nunber.
[Lhuynh] 11/10/2006 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Delete the current tool number and its associated class number in the MOP Tool Data table.
This example shows how to call the Delete mothod.
Dim objCmdMopTool As CMOPTool Dim intToolNo As Integer = 1 Dim intClassNo As Integer = 1 objCmdMopTool = New CMOPTool objCmdMopTool.Delete(intToolNo, intClassNo)
Tool number. Valid tool number is ranging from 1 - 999. Classification number for this tool number. Valid class numbers is from 0 to 9. Thrown when function failes to perform the operation at current NC condition. Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system
NC will assigned a MOP Tool data number for each tool number and its classification number automatically based on the current MOP Tool Data list such that the order of tool numbers and its classification numbers are displayed in ascending order. Therefore, a MOP Tool Data number assigned for a pair of tool number and its classification number could be changed if there is a deletion or addition to the MOP Tool Data table. For example, if tool number 45-0 is removed from the MOP Tool Data list, then tool 50-0 will has a MOP Tool Data number 4.
MOP TOOL - TOOL DATA SETING - ENTRY TOOL LIST - list of all MOP Tool Data and its associated tool number with classification nunber.
[Lhuynh] 11/10/2006 Created

This function has multiple overload methods to register tool/pot for Fixed/Random Address ATC.
Fixed Address ATC: Register a tool at the specified pot number. A combination of group number and serial number are assigned and to be used as tool number for a pot.
This example shows how to call the RegisterToolPot mothod.
Dim objCmdATC2 As CATC2 Dim intGroupNo As Integer = 1 Dim intPotNo As Integer = 1 Dim intSerialNo As Integer = 1 Dim blnDummyTool As Boolean = False Dim strToolName As String = "" objCmdATC2 = New CATC2() objCmdATC2.RegisterToolPot(intPotNo, intGroupNo, intSerialNo, blnDummyTool,strToolName)
Pot number where a tool will be registered to. Pot number is 1 to the maximum pot number. Group number to be assigned to this pot. Group number will be ignored if tool is registered as DUMMY TOOL. Tool group number is 1 to 9999 in case of NC OP. bit No.57 bit1 ON. Tool group number is 1 to 99999999 in case of NC OP. bit No.57 bit1 OFF Serial number to be assigned to this pot. Serial number will be ignored if tool is registered as DUMMY TOOL. Tool serial number is 1 to 9999. Tool name can have a maximum 16 characters composed of single-space capital A-Z, 0-9. Optionally, a DUMMY tool is registered into this pot. True if it is a DUMMY Tool, otherwise false. Optionally, a tool name can be assinged to this pot. Tool name will be ignored if tool is registered as DUMMY TOOL. The first character of tool name cannot be '.' or '-'. Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system TOOL DATA - TOOL ID INFORMATION - POT TOOL TABLE - POT - TOOL SET
Fixed ATC
[Lhuynh] 11/28/2007 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Fixed Address ATC: Un-register a tool at the specified pot number.
Random Address ATC: Un-register a tool at the specified tool and pot number.
This example shows how to call the UnRegisterToolPot mothod.
Dim objCmdATC2 As CATC2 Dim intPotNo As Integer = 1 Dim intToolNo As Integer = 1 Dim blnRandomATC As Boolean objCmdATC2 = New CATC2() objCmdATC2.UnRegisterToolPot (intPotNo, intToolNo, blnRandomATC)
Pot number where the current registered tool to be un-registered Tool number currently registered in the specified Pot number. For ATC Random only Specified wheter this operation is for Random Address ATC type or not. Default value is false Thrown when function failes to perform the operation at current NC condition. Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system TOOL DATA - TOOL ID INFORMATION - POT TOOL TABLE - POT - TOOL SET - TOOL NO. CLEAR
Fixed ATC
Random ATC
[Lhuynh] 11/28/2007 Created [Lhuynh] 10/1/2008 revise to support Random ATC
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Tool number to be registered into the specified pot number. Tool number is 1 to the maximum tool number. Pot number where a tool will be registered to. Pot number is 1 to the maximum pot number. Group number to be assigned to this pot. Group number will be ignored if tool is registered as DUMMY TOOL. Tool group number is 1 to 9999 in case of NC OP. bit No.57 bit1 ON. Tool group number is 1 to 99999999 in case of NC OP. bit No.57 bit1 OFF Serial number to be assigned to this pot. Serial number will be ignored if tool is registered as DUMMY TOOL. Tool serial number is 1 to 9999. Tool name can have a maximum 16 characters composed of single-space capital A-Z, 0-9. Optionally, a DUMMY tool is registered into this pot. True if it is a DUMMY Tool, otherwise false. Optionally, a tool name can be assinged to this pot. Tool name will be ignored if tool is registered as DUMMY TOOL. The first character of tool name cannot be '.' or '-'. Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system TOOL DATA - TOOL ID INFORMATION - POT TOOL TABLE - TOOL - TOOL SET

For OSP-P200/P100II, Un-register a tool at the specified pot number.
For OSP-P300, only a tool currently registered in ATC table will be un-assigned from ATC table while NC is not running. This function requires NC spec code [31,7] is ON.
Note: The tool still exists in Tool Data table after detaching from ATC table.
This example shows how to call the UnRegisterToolPot method.
Dim objCmdATC As CATC Dim intPotNo As Integer objCmdATC = New CATC() objCmdATC.UnRegisterToolPot(intPotNo)
Pot number of tool to be un-registered Thrown when function failes to perform the operation at current NC condition. Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system
On OSP-P200, after the tool is un-registered at the specified pot, a 'NONE' will be displayed at the specified pot number in the ATC Tool Pot table.
***********************************************************
For OSP-P300 controls:
This function is required to operate in an exclusive mode.
It means it must be able to enter Edit Tool Data mode exclusively from other applications running on Windows including NC.
At any point in time only one application can be in Edit Tool Data mode
Attempting to unregister a POT with no Tool loaded will return an error
8 Digits Tool ID specification must be OFF
POT NO./TOOL NO. TABLE - ATC Tool Pot Table
OSP-P300 - TOOL DATA - MAGAZINE INFO. - POT/T-NO.
[Lhuynh] 11/10/2006 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

----------------------------------------------------------------------------- This function has multiple overload methods to register tool at the specified pot number.
Register a tool at the specified pot number.
For OSP-P300, Register a new tool into the system and attach the tool into the specified magazine pot number if provided when NC is not running. This function requires NC spec code [31,7] is ON.
This example shows how to call the RegisterToolPot method.
Dim objCmdATC As CATC Dim intToolNo As Integer = 1 Dim intPotNo As Integer = 10 objCmdATC = New CATC() objCmdATC.RegisterToolPot(intPotNo, intToolNo)
Pot number where a tool will be assigned to. Tool number to be registered Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system
********* For OSP-P200/P100II controls, this method will register a tool at the specified pot number without using any tool attribute such as a tool with large diameter.
********* For OSP-P300 controls:
This function is required to operate in an exclusive mode.
It means it must be able to enter Edit Tool Data mode exclusively from other applications running on Windows including NC.
At any point in time only one application can be in Edit Tool Data mode
8 Digits Tool ID specification must be OFF
POT NO./TOOL NO. TABLE - ATC Tool Pot Table
OSP-P300 - TOOL DATA - MAGAZINE INFO. - POT/T-NO.
[Lhuynh] 11/10/2006 Created

Pot number where a tool will be registered to. Tool number to be registered Tool attribute of the tool to be registered. Values of parameter come from the Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.ToolAttributeEnum enumeration. Thrown when function failes to perform the operation at current NC condition. Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system
For OSP-P100/P200: This method will register a tool including tool attribute at the specified pot number such as a tool with large diameter. To register a pot as dummy tool pot, register a valid tool number with an attribute of ToolAttributeEnum.DummyTool.
********* For OSP-P300 controls: Dummy tool attribute cannot be supported in P300 control. Dummy Tool displayed as 'D' will be inserted automatically by the system if needed.
This function is required to operate in an exclusive mode.
It means it must be able to enter Edit Tool Data mode exclusively from other applications running on Windows including NC.
At any point in time only one application can be in Edit Tool Data mode
8 Digits Tool ID specification must be OFF
POT NO./TOOL NO. TABLE - ATC Tool Pot Table

Set a tool number as actual tool for Randdom/Fixed Address ATC Type.
This example shows how to call the SetActualTool mothod.
Dim objCmdATC As CATC Dim intToolNo As Integer Dim enToolAttribute As ToolAttributeEnum objCmdATC = New CATC() objCmdATC.SetActualTool(intToolNo, enToolAttribute)
Tool number to be set as Actual Tool. Setting value of zero will set Actual tool to NONE
For OSP-P300, Setting value of zero will set Actual tool to NONE if current actual tool is other then NONE only.
For OSP-P200/P100II only: Tool attribute of the tool to be set as Actual tool in Random Adress ATC Type only. Values of parameter come from the Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.ToolAttributeEnum enumeration. Thrown when function failes to perform the operation at current NC condition. Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system
********** For OSP-P100II/P200 controls: **********
For ATC Fixed Address: This method will set a registered tool as the Actual Tool. Tool attribute is ignored if specified as part of tool number. The tool attribute will be the attribute of current registered tool number if any.
For ATC Radnom Address: This method will set a non-registered tool number as the Actual Tool. Tool attribute can be set as part of the tool number.
********** For OSP-P300 controls: **********
NC is in MANUAL mode ONLY
******** For Fixed Address ATC type:
Tool number must have been assigned in ATC table and no tool currently assigned in spindle
******** For Random Address ATC type:
Tool number must have been registered with the system only (not assigned in ATC table).
***********************************************************
This function is required to operate in an exclusive mode.
It means it must be able to enter Edit Tool Data mode exclusively from other applications running on Windows including NC.
At any point in time only one application can be in Edit Tool Data mode
8 Digits Tool ID specification must be OFF
POT NO./TOOL NO. TABLE - ATC Tool Pot Table
Actual Tool (ACT) in Fixed Address ATC Type
Actual Tool (ACT) in Random Address ATC Type
OSP-P300: TOOL DATA - MAGAZINE INFO. - ACT T-NO
[Lhuynh] 10/10/2007 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

This example shows how to call the SetNextTool method.
Dim objCmdATC As CATC Dim intToolNo as Integer objCmdATC = New CATC() objCmdATC.SetNextTool(intToolNo)
A registered tool number to be set as Next Tool Thrown when function failes to perform the operation at current NC condition. Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system
******** For OSP-P100II/P200, machine equipped with Random Address ATC type, Next Tool or Return Pot number can only be set if the other is set to NONE.
******** For OSP-P300 controls, NC must be in MANUAL mode.
Tool must be registered and attached to ATC table before it can be assigned to NEXT TOOL.
This function is required to operate in an exclusive mode.
It means it must be able to enter Edit Tool Data mode exclusively from other applications running on Windows including NC.
At any point in time only one application can be in Edit Tool Data mode
8 Digits Tool ID specification must be OFF
POT NO./TOOL NO. TABLE - ATC Tool Pot Table
Next Tool (NXT) in Fixed Address ATC Type
Next Tool (NXT) in Random Address ATC Type
TOOL DATA - MAGAZINE INFO. - NXT T-NO

Register a new tool into the system when pot number is zero.
Register a new tool into the system and attach the tool into the specified magazine pot number if provided when NC is not running. This function requires NC spec code [31,7] is ON
Optionally, it will also register other tool attributes
This example shows how to call the RegisterTool method.
Dim objCmdATC As CATC = New CATC Dim intToolNo As Integer Dim intPotNo As Integer Dim enToolKind As ToolKind2Enum = ToolKind2Enum.Normal Dim enDiameterKind As DiameterKindEnum = DiameterKindEnum.Normal Dim enWeightKind As WeightKindEnum = ToolKind2Enum.Normal Dim enHeightKind As HeightKindEnum = HeightKindEnum.Normal Dim blnThroughCoolantTool As Boolean = False Dim intMaxSpeed As Integer = 0 Dim blnManualAttatchToolATCType As Boolean = False objCmdATC.RegisterTool(intToolNo, intPotNo, enToolKind, enDiameterKind, nWeightKind, enHeightKind, blnThroughCoolantTool, intMaxToolSpeed, blnManualAttachmentToolATCType)
Tool number to be registered into the system Magazine pot number where a registered tool will be assigned to. If Pot number is 0, tool will be registered into the system only without attaching to a pot. Tool Kind. Default to Normal Diameter Kind. Default to Normal Weight Kind. Default to Normal Height Kind. Default to Normal Through Coolant Tool when PLC 3 spec code [3,5]. Default value is False Maximum speed of tool if applicable when PLC 1 spec code [31,6] is on. Default to 0 or not applicable. Manual Attachment Tool ATC Type when PLC 3 spec code [3,3] is on. Default value is FALSE Thrown when function failes to perform the operation at current NC condition. Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system

Save the tool data information given registered tool number, and the destination folder.
Tool data will be stored into a file in the following format: Txxxxxxxx.TDF where x is the actual tool number. Ex: T00000001.TDF for tool number 1. T99999999.TDF for tool number 99999999
This example shows how to call the save and load tool data using ToolDataInput/ToolDataOutput methods.
Registered Tool number to be saved full path where tool data file is stored Overwrite tool data file if it is set to TRUE. member.name: M:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CATCPanel.ClearError
member.summary: Clear error on ATC Sub panel. ATC panel must be in ATCSubPanelOperationModeEnum.Write mode. Please using Okuma.CMDATAPI.DATAPI.CATC.SetATCPanelOperationMode(ATCSubPanelOperationModeEnum enValue) function to set the desired operation mode.
member.example:
This example shows how to call ClearError method.
Dim objATC As New Okuma.CMDATAPI.DataAPI.CATC Dim objCmdATCPanel As New CATCPanel try objATC.SetATCPanelOperationMode(ATCSubPanelOperationModeEnum.Write) objCmdATCPanel.ClearError() objATC.SetATCPanelOperationMode(ATCSubPanelOperationModeEnum.Read) Catch ex As Exception .... .... Finally objATC.SetATCPanelOperationMode(ATCSubPanelOperationModeEnum.Read) End Try
member.exception: Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system.

remarks.para: This function currently requires B-spec software

Compatible Chart of this class for different OSP controls:
OSP Control Compatible
P100II No
P200 No
P300M Yes
P300S Yes

member.name: M:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CATCPanel.SetIndexPotNo(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Set pot number for ATC sub panel operations. ATC panel must be in ATCSubPanelOperationModeEnum.Write mode ONLY
CALL or STORAGE operation on ATC sub panel will ONLY use pot number to locate the tool in the matrix magazine to be retrieved or stored.
Once the pot number is written to NC, the LED light of either Call or Storage push button on the ATC sub panel will be lit up if the machine conditions are met.
- MANUAL INT. switch is at | position (ON position)
- LED on CALL push button is ON if there is a registered tool at the specified pot number and no tool is currently inserted at loading/unloading station/pot
- LED on STORAGE push button is ON if there is no tool at the specified pot number and a tool is currently inserted at loading/unloading station/pot
Call or Storage operation can be performed accordingly on ATC sub panel. Tool Data currently displayed on ATC sub panel
member.example:
This example shows how to call SetIndexPotNo method. Assuming that a tool has been registered in the system, then the pot number can be obtained using SearchPotNo functions given group and serial number.
Dim objCmdATCPanel As New CATCPanel Dim objATC As New Okuma.CMDATAPI.DataAPI.CATC Dim intIndexPotNo As Integer Dim intGroupNo As Integer Dim intSerialNo As Integer intIndexPotNo = objATCPanel.SearchPotNo(intGroupNo, intSerialNo) objATC.SetATCPanelOperationMode(ATCSubPanelOperationModeEnum.Write) objCmdATCPanel.SetIndexPotNo(intIndexPotNo) objATC.SetATCPanelOperationMode(ATCSubPanelOperationModeEnum.Read)
...
... Call or Storage LED will be lit on and is ready for operation if machine condition is met.
member.param: Pot number to be set to NC for either Call or Storage operation
member.exception: Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system.

remarks.para:
The following specifications must be met in order to function:
Specification Valid/Invalid
ATC Sub panel NC spec [6,1] Valid

Compatible Chart of this class for different OSP controls:

P100II No
P200 No
P300M Yes
P300S Yes

member.name: F:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.LoggingLevelEnum.logGet
member.summary: Level 3 – Level 2 + all read functions. Setting the level to 3 or greater will force logging of ALL calls to the API to facilitate debugging of your application. This function is CPU intensive and should only be used for debugging purposes.

member.name: F:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.LoggingLevelEnum.logAll
member.summary: Level 4 – all logging events regardless of level. Setting the level to 3 or greater will force logging of ALL calls to the API to facilitate debugging of your application. This function is CPU intensive and should only be used for debugging purposes.

members.member:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
List of axes movement order when sequence restart is performed.
[Lhuynh] 11/5/2007 Created OCJ DOCUMENT ENUMERATE IN OPPOSITE DIRECTION. USE NC HMI ORDER
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Operation mode - NC is under either Auto/MDI/Manual mode.
Auto/MDI/Manual mode cannot be changed by this command, but the screen can be changed while NC in one of these modes.
For example, screen can be changed from ACTUAL POSITION to MAIN PROGRAM.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
In this mode program and data files can be edited, input/output, displayed, and deleted

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
In this mode the parameter data necessary for numerical control can be set, changed, an displayed.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
In this mode the zero offset data and zero offset shift data which define a program coordinate system can be set, changed, or checked.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Sets the Command MDI string into the MDI buffer.
This example shows how to call the InputMDI method.
Dim objCmdMachine As Okuma.CMCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CMachine Dim strMDICommand As String = "G1X100" objCmdMachine = New Okuma.CMCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CMachine objCmdMachine.InputMDI(strMDICommand)
MDI command
After the MDI command string is inserted into the NC MDI buffer screen, a cycle start from control is needed to execute the MDI command.
MDI - G1X100 is inserted to NC MDI buffer. A cycle start is needed to carry out the MDI command.
[Lhuynh] 11/10/2006 Created

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sets user alarm
Alarm Message displayed on NC-HMI will have the following format:
FOR ALARM D: 4127 ALARM-D PROGRAM DIRECT THINC Alarm + strAlarmMessage
FOR ALARM C: 3127 ALARM-C PROGRAM DIRECT THINC Alarm + strAlarmMessage
FOR ALARM B: 2127 ALARM-B PROGRAM DIRECT THINC Alarm + strAlarmMessage
This example shows how to call the SetUserAlarm method.
Dim objCmdMachine As Okuma.CMCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CMachine Dim enUserAlarm as UserAlarmEnum = UserAlarmEnum.B Dim strAlarmMessage as String = "ALARM B" objCmdMachine = New Okuma.CMCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CMachine objCmdMachine.SetUserAlarm(enUserAlarm, strAlarmMessage)
alarm level to be set alarm message to be set for this alarm level. String length must be equal to or less than 15 characters. Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system
********************* This function cannot be supported in OSP-P100 II machines. ************************
********************* This function requires license feature Okuma.MC.UserAlarm if applicable. ************************

Load the specified part program file into NC. Optionally, it can also load sub program file name, or run a particular program name.
This example shows how to call the SelectMainProgram mothod.
Dim objCmdProgram As New CProgram Dim strMainProgram As String ="" Dim strSubProgram As String = "" Dim strProgramName As String = "" Dim enFileReadMode As FileReadModeEnum = FileReadModeEnum.A objCmdProgram.SelectMainProgram(strMainProgram, strSubProgram, strProgramName, enFileReadMode)
Main program file name to be loaded into NC Sub program file name to be used by this main program Name of program in the main program file to be run. Name must be starting with an O and a maximum length of characters is 5. File read mode applied to main program file Thrown when function failes to perform the operation at current NC condition. Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system
All files should be located in the default MD1 folder of the OSP system. In order to load program with B or S method, NC Optional parameter WORD # 11 must be set to 1 for B method, or 2 for S method, respectively.

member.name: M:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CProgram.ReturnSearch(System.String,Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.AxisMovementOrderEnum,Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.MIDBlockRestartEnum,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Perform the return search operation. The return search and sequence restart functions are used to restart automatic operation after taking necessary measures like changing a tool if automatic operation is interrupted due to problems such as tool breakage. The return search function processes the program up to the specified sequence while moving the pointer.
For more information, please refer to Machining Center Operation Manual - Section 5 Automatic Operation - Return Search and Sequence Restart
member.example:
This example shows how to call ReturnSearch method.
Dim objCmdProgram As New CProgram Dim strSequence As String Dim intOrderNumber As Integer Dim enAxisMovementOrder As Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.AxisMovementOrderEnum Dim enMidBlockRestart As Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.MIDBlockRestartEnum Dim intNumberRelativeBlock As Integer Dim intRepeatnumber As Integer objCMDProgram.ReturnSearch(strSequence, enAxisMovementOrder, enMidBlockRestart, intNumberRelativeBlock, intRepeatnumber)

param.name: strSequence
param.para: Sequence number or block counter. Sequence restart starts with N + 5 sequence numbers. For example, N1234 is a sequence name.

The sequence name or block counter input field can accept the input of asterisk “*”. The asterisk “*” means the previously executed block counter value (displayed on the title bar of the screen). Further, + or – sign can be used for addition or subtraction of the block counter value.

Ex. If you input “*–2” when the previous counter value is 415, the program return to the block No. 413. If a block counter is input instead of a sequence name, the RESTART pop-up window does not display the relative number of blocks from the sequence name to the return point or the number of repetitions. Set the other items in the same manner as the items displayed by the input of a sequence name.

member.param: Specified the axis movement order when sequence restart is perfromed. Values of parameter come from the Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.AxisMovementOrderEnum enumeration.

param.name: enMidBlockRestart
param.para: Enables sequence restart from the point where the operation was interrupted. In addition, the order of axis movements to return to the sequence restart point can be set by assigning the priority to the axes.Values of parameter come from the Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.MIDBlockRestartEnum enumeration.
For more information on MID-BLOCK RESTART please refer to the OSP-P200M Special Functions Manual No. 1 - SECTION 4 UPGRADED SEQUENCE RESTART FUNCTION (MID-BLOCK RESTART FUNCTION)

member.param: Specified the relative number of blocks (A NUMBER OF BLOCK BEYOND SEQ. NAME) from sequence name to the return point.
member.para: Applied only when a sequence name is specified to the first parameter.
member.param:
The “order” when designating a sequence name is a value that specifies, in cases where the same sequence number occurs a number of times in the same part program, the position of the sequence number from which the sequence is to be restarted. It indicates which occurrence of the sequence number - starting from the first block of the part program - is the relevant one.
Applied only when a sequence name is specified to the first parameter.
member.remarks:
The Return Search operation is only valid in AUTO MODE operation. In other mode, no operation is carried out or ignore. An error occurs if return search is executed during the execution of a schedule or main program.
The Axis Movement Order and Mid Block Restart parameters will be ignored in the operation if Spec code number 11 bit 6 is not enabled.
member.exception: Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system.
member.history: [Lhuynh] 11/05/2007 Created Support in MCMCAPI.exe version 1.0.2.1, MC.dll 41.1.0.0

members.member:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Load the specified sub part program into NC.
This example shows how to call the SelectSubProgram method.
Dim objCmdProgram As New CProgram Dim strSubProgramName as string objCmdProgram.SelectSubProgram(strSubProgramName)
Sub program name to be loaded into NC. It is either OSPR1 or OSPR2. Sub programs must be loaded into NC by this API before NC part program is running. Thrown when function failes to perform the operation at current NC condition. Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system
Compatible Chart of this function for different OSP controls:
OSP Control Compatible
P100II No
P200 No
P300M Yes
P300S Yes
Required NC SPRINT Library 2 spec code [7,3] ON
OSPR1.MIN and OSPR2.MIN should be located in the default MD1 folder of the OSP system.
The sub program file OSPR1.MIN must contain program name OSPR1.
The sub program file OSPR2.MIN must contain program name OSPR2.
[Lhuynh] 09/20/2012 Created Refer to OCJ SPRINT Specification_21.ppt Init and set library buffer from NC to 100 when in loading library program setting page Register library program OSPR.lib. As a result NC will add 2 sub program named OSPR1 and OSPR2 with size = 22 in the table Run part program OSPR.MIN Using THINC-API to load OSPR1 before NC program executes N100 CALL OSPR1 if not NC will error Using THINC-API to load OSPR2 before NC program executes N100 CALL OSPR2 if not NC will error
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Load the specified sub part program into NC with the specified read mode
This example shows how to call the SelectSubProgram method.
Dim objCmdProgram As New CProgram Dim strSubProgramName as string Dim enReadMode as ReadModeEnum = ReadModeEnum.A objCmdProgram.SelectSubProgram(strSubProgramName, enReadMode)
Sub program name to be loaded into NC. It is either OSPR1 or OSPR2. Sub programs must be loaded into NC by this API before NC part program is running. Read mode to be used when loading program into NC. Values of parameter come from the Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.ReadModeEnum enumeration. Thrown when function failes to perform the operation at current NC condition. Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system
Compatible Chart of this function for different OSP controls:
OSP Control Compatible
P100II No
P200 No
P300M Yes
P300S Yes
Required NC SPRINT Library 2 spec code [7,3] ON
OSPR1.MIN and OSPR2.MIN should be located in the default MD1 folder of the OSP system.
The sub program file OSPR1.MIN must contain program name OSPR1.
The sub program file OSPR2.MIN must contain program name OSPR2.
********************* This function can only be supported in OSP-P200 machines. ************************
[Lhuynh] 09/20/2012 Created Refer to OCJ SPRINT Specification_21.ppt Init and set library buffer from NC to 100 when in loading library program setting page Register library program OSPR.lib. As a result NC will add 2 sub program named OSPR1 and OSPR2 with size = 22 in the table Run part program OSPR.MIN Using THINC-API to load OSPR1 before NC program executes N100 CALL OSPR1 if not NC will error Using THINC-API to load OSPR2 before NC program executes N100 CALL OSPR2 if not NC will error
